instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

[SIZE=4][FONT=Segoe UI]The system came in dead found a partial short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SPKRAMP</SIGNAL> diode mode reading is 0.0073 and <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> is getting hot on thermal camera.
Short gone but still draws 5.17v 0.0A,<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is now 1V
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> has 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is 0V..
What should I do next ðŸ¤”[/FONT][/SIZE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is 0V"
Must get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> first; try to understand the schematic.

Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Checked if F7000 isn't burnt?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.433
F7000 is okay

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> -5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>- 0.265 v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL>- 1.2v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL> -0.002v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AUX_DET</SIGNAL>-1.2v
Resistance on all point ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_R_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_R_N</SIGNAL>
There's no open circuit between them and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1V 
CSIN 5V
CSIP 0V
<SIGNAL>PBUS_PWR</SIGNAL> 5v
Aux DET 1.25

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.17V 0.00A no power
threads.message:
CSOP/N [U][B]must[/B][/U] have equal voltage; same valid for CSIP/N.
Do you really get 2 ohm over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23?
